intro: Justicia hylobia, commonly known as the red mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and Mexico. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, red or pink tubular flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Justicia hylobia is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
